quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live as if there isn't and to die to find out that there is.
author: Albert Camus

quote: So I say to you, Ask and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
author: Jesus Christ
Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.

quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: When I do good I feel good, when I do bad I feel bad, and that's my religion.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: All religions must be tolerated... for every man must get to heaven in his own way.
author: Epictetus

quote: I like the religion that teaches liberty, equality and fraternity.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil. If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Religion is part of the human make-up. It's also part of our cultural and intellectual history. Religion was our first attempt at literature, the texts, our first attempt at cosmology, making sense of where we are in the universe, our first attempt at health care, believing in faith healing, our first attempt at philosophy.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: The Kingdom of Heaven is not a place, but a state of mind.
author: John Burroughs

quote: One act of obedience is better than one hundred sermons.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: There are many of us that are willing to do great things for the Lord, but few of us are willing to do little things.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: Religion is not a department of life; it is something that enters into the whole of it.
author: Alan Watts

quote: It is easy to talk on religion, but difficult to practice it.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: We have to pray with our eyes on God, not on the difficulties.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: God made everything out of nothing, but the nothingness shows through.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Worship is a way of seeing the world in the light of God.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quote: See, I have set before you this day life and good, death and evil... I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse; therefore choose life.
author: Moses

quote: Anti-religious sneers are a hallmark of perpetual adolescents.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: It is only when men begin to worship that they begin to grow.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Just as the soul fills the body, so God fills the world. Just as the soul bears the body, so God endures the world. Just as the soul sees but is not seen, so God sees but is not seen. Just as the soul feeds the body, so God gives food to the world.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Where it is a duty to worship the sun it is pretty sure to be a crime to examine the laws of heat.
author: John Morley

quote: When the missionaries came to Africa they had the Bible and we had the land. They said 'Let us pray.' We closed our eyes. When we opened them we had the Bible and they had the land.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: I prayed for twenty years but received no answer until I prayed with my legs.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
author: Buddha

quote: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: To be a Christian without prayer is no more possible than to be alive without breathing.
author: Martin Luther

quote: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Within the covers of the Bible are the answers for all the problems men face.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: We are punished by our sins, not for them.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: No man ever believes that the Bible means what it says: He is always convinced that it says what he means.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Science can purify religion from error and superstition. Religion can purify science from idolatry and false absolutes.
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Prayer is aligning ourselves with the purposes of God.
author: E. Stanley Jones

quote: We can only learn to know ourselves and do what we can - namely, surrender our will and fulfill God's will in us.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Human beings must be known to be loved; but Divine beings must be loved to be known.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.
author: Unknown

quote: If, then, you are looking for the way by which you should go, take Christ, because He Himself is the way.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Only a god can save us.
author: Martin Heidegger

quote: We are always on the anvil; by trials God is shaping us for higher things.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.
author: William Blake

quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Religion is everywhere. There are no human societies without it, whether they acknowledge it as a religion or not.
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: Even if a unity of faith is not possible, a unity of love is.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quote: The more I study religions the more I am convinced that man never worshipped anything but himself.
author: Richard Burton

quote: Let your religion be less of a theory and more of a love affair.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I'm a Muslim, but I think Jesus would have a drink with me. He would be cool. He would talk to me.
author: Mike Tyson

quote: We are a religious people whose institutions presuppose a Supreme Being.
author: William O. Douglas
